Our faith in Christ empowers us to pray in the Spirit You can pray in the Spirit daily Jude says, Jude 20 But you, beloved, building yourselves up on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Spirit What is "praying in the Spirit?" 3 aspects 1) Praying in the Spirit is Jesus prompting us and praying through us in our weakness Romans 8:26 Likewise the Spirit also helps in our weaknesses. For we do not know what we should pray for as we ought, but the Spirit Himself makes intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered. 27 Now He who searches the hearts knows what the mind of the Spirit is, because He makes intercession for the saints according to the will of God. 28 And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose. The Holy Spirit prays through us as we seek God's will. We must seek God's will on matters of our life Ex. I take prayer walks and call out to God... This kind of prayer can be praying in our own language, in our own tongue, sharing our heart with God Prayer empowered by the Spirit is letting Christ take over my prayers. Asking him to pray through me ! Prayer prompted by the Spirit 2) Praying in t he Spirit can be through an Unknown Tongue, a Prayer Language that the Spirit supernaturally gives you 1 Cor. 14: 2 For he who speaks in a tongue does not speak to men but to God, for no one understands him; however, in the spirit he speaks mysteries. 1 Cor 14:14 For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful. What is the conclusion then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will also pray with the understanding. Ex. Intimacy with the Lord —knowing that he knows your heart, you pour out your heart to him This builds up our faith!
